title: Music-KG-Project
description: The Music-KG-Project is a comprehensive initiative focused on constructing a knowledge graph that maps relationships between various musical elements, such as artists, albums, and tracks. It integrates data from multiple sources to provide a structured representation of music metadata, facilitating advanced data analysis and exploration.

title: CascaProject
description: The Casca Project is designed to assess loan eligibility by analyzing financial documents, such as bank statements, using OpenAI's GPT-4 model. It converts PDFs into images, organizes them systematically, and employs a tailored prompt to extract and evaluate relevant financial data.

title: SetupForge
description: SetupForge is a Windows desktop application developed in C++ using wxWidgets, designed to automate software installations and system configurations. It enables users to create and execute custom scripts for tasks like running executables, managing files and directories, setting environment variables, editing the registry, and mapping network drives.

title: cs566-project
description: The SegOne project focuses on developing a channel-wise 1D convolutional U-Net, known as OneNet, designed for efficient and accurate segmentation of one-dimensional data. This architecture is particularly suited for applications requiring precise analysis of sequential data.

title: E-DataSync-Distributed-E-Commerce-Inventory-Management
description: E-DataSync is a distributed e-commerce inventory management system that integrates backend database management with a user-friendly web interface, facilitating efficient inventory tracking and management.

title: pe-consensus-scoring
description: The PE Consensus Scoring project implements algorithms for consensus evaluation and article publishing, deployed on AWS Lambda. It processes messages from an SQS queue to perform tasks such as calculating consensus scores and managing article publication statuses.

title: software-dev
description: The software-dev repository contains prototype files developed by the Public Editor Software Development Team. It includes various components such as web scrapers, Java servers, Chrome extensions, visualizations, and mobile applications, reflecting a diverse range of development efforts.

title: 2022-wi-stats21
description: The repository contains instructional materials for a statistics course, including Jupyter notebooks, PDFs, and R Markdown files covering topics like Git basics, Jupyter Notebook usage, and fundamental data types.

title: CalHackss
description: The CalHackss repository contains partial code from a project developed during the CalHacks hackathon. Due to GitHub's 50MB storage limit, the complete codebase isn't uploaded.

title: chrisapton.github.io
description: This repository contains the source code and assets for my personal website, built using GitHub Pages.

title: Coding_Assessment_2024
description: The Applicant Compatibility Scoring System is a Python script that evaluates candidates for a technical team by calculating compatibility scores based on attributes like intelligence, strength, endurance, and spicy food tolerance. It utilizes NumPy and pandas for data processing and requires an input JSON file named `input.json` to operate.

title: Heart-Disease-Prediction
description: The Heart Disease Prediction project involves analyzing heart disease datasets using R to develop predictive models. It includes R Markdown files, datasets, and a PDF report detailing the analysis and findings.

title: MITHacks
description: Enlighten Me is a web application that facilitates real-time debates on controversial topics. Built with a Python Flask backend and a frontend utilizing HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and React, it presents users with a "Change My Mind" image featuring a contentious statement. Participants engage in a five-minute discussion before the topic refreshes, clearing the chat for a new conversation.

title: projects
description: The GitHub repository at [https://github.com/chrisapton/projects](https://github.com/chrisapton/projects) currently contains a `README.md` file and a `hello.txt` file. However, it lacks a detailed description, website link, or specified topics, making it challenging to provide a comprehensive overview of its contents.

title: round_robin
description: The Round Robin repository contains the source code and assets for the Encore Round Robin website, which is accessible at [roundrobinstore.com](https://roundrobinstore.com). The repository includes HTML files for various pages such as `index.html`, `contact.html`, and `gallery.html`, along with a `style.css` file for styling and an `images` directory for visual content. Additionally, it features a `CNAME` file, indicating a custom domain setup, and a `robots.txt` file for managing search engine indexing.

title: STATS-199-Research-SPR-2023
description: This repository contains materials from a research project conducted during the Spring 2023 semester of STATS 199. It includes Jupyter notebooks, a final project report, and code documentation.

title: chrisapton.github.io
description: This repository contains the source code and assets for my personal website, built using GitHub Pages.
